html: NEW VIDEO: Chairman @SenPatRoberts Hears Stakeholder, Participant Perspectives Ahead of #ChildNutrition Reauthorization
text: NEW VIDEO: Chairman @SenPatRoberts Hears Stakeholder, Participant Perspectives Ahead of #ChildNutrition Reauthorization

html: Roberts: There is a pathway for #childnutrition programs to be reauthorized in a bipartisan manner yet this year. Today’s hearing is the first step in this process.
text: Roberts: There is a pathway for #childnutrition programs to be reauthorized in a bipartisan manner yet this year. Today’s hearing is the first step in this process.

html: Roberts: Today, we will hear from the USDA's Food and Nutrition Service, the Government Accountability Office, and those who are operating and implementing these #ChildNutrition programs at the ground-level.
text: Roberts: Today, we will hear from the USDA's Food and Nutrition Service, the Government Accountability Office, and those who are operating and implementing these #ChildNutrition programs at the ground-level.

html: Roberts: These #ChildNutrition programs combined account for $30 billion in annual mandatory and discretionary spending. So, it is important for us—meaning Congress and more directly this Committee—to review how these programs are working.
text: Roberts: These #ChildNutrition programs combined account for $30 billion in annual mandatory and discretionary spending. So, it is important for us—meaning Congress and more directly this Committee—to review how these programs are working.

html: Roberts: The Special Milk Program, the Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Program, the Farm to School Program, and other programs are also part of the #ChildNutrition Reauthorization process.
text: Roberts: The Special Milk Program, the Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Program, the Farm to School Program, and other programs are also part of the #ChildNutrition Reauthorization process.

html: Roberts: #ChildNutrition Reauthorization includes: the National School Lunch Program, the National School Breakfast Program, the Summer Food Service Program, the Child and Adult Care Food Program, and the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children.
text: Roberts: #ChildNutrition Reauthorization includes: the National School Lunch Program, the National School Breakfast Program, the Summer Food Service Program, the Child and Adult Care Food Program, and the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children.

html: Roberts: The same is true for non-profit and charitable organizations, and of course, for the participants—the children, the students, the mothers and families who use these programs. #childnutrition 2/2
text: Roberts: The same is true for non-profit and charitable organizations, and of course, for the participants—the children, the students, the mothers and families who use these programs. #childnutrition 2/2

html: Roberts: I have visited many #Kansas schools as there are close to 300 school districts in Kansas. Considering how many districts there are in the US, and how different each district is, it is clear that a one-size fits all approach will not work for everyone. #childnutrition 1/2
text: Roberts: I have visited many #Kansas schools as there are close to 300 school districts in Kansas. Considering how many districts there are in the US, and how different each district is, it is clear that a one-size fits all approach will not work for everyone. #childnutrition 1/2

html: Roberts: School food service directors are always stretching every dollar to provide nutritious, affordable meals to students. They are finding creative ways to prepare foods so students will eat them. Ever-changing rules and reporting makes this more difficult. #childnutrition
text: Roberts: School food service directors are always stretching every dollar to provide nutritious, affordable meals to students. They are finding creative ways to prepare foods so students will eat them. Ever-changing rules and reporting makes this more difficult. #childnutrition

html: Roberts: The last #childnutrition reauthorization was completed in 2010. So, it is again necessary to take a fresh look to find ways to provide certainty, to reduce administrative redundancies, and allow flexibility at the local level to better serve participants and stakeholders
text: Roberts: The last #childnutrition reauthorization was completed in 2010. So, it is again necessary to take a fresh look to find ways to provide certainty, to reduce administrative redundancies, and allow flexibility at the local level to better serve participants and stakeholders

html: Roberts: This hearing examines #childnutrition programs, which have consistently benefited from broad, bipartisan support. The Committee looks forward to that continuing today as we hear perspectives on Child Nutrition Reauthorization.
text: Roberts: This hearing examines #childnutrition programs, which have consistently benefited from broad, bipartisan support. The Committee looks forward to that continuing today as we hear perspectives on Child Nutrition Reauthorization.

html: News Release: Senator Roberts: American Farmers and Ranchers Don’t Need #GreenNewDeal to Be Green https://www.roberts.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/pressreleases?id=A1101E7E-1A6A-4A35-B9D0-F8F101EE97C7 …
text:
News Release: Senator Roberts: American Farmers and Ranchers Don’t Need #GreenNewDeal to Be Green 
https://www.roberts.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/pressreleases?id=A1101E7E-1A6A-4A35-B9D0-F8F101EE97C7 …

html: In hampering American agriculture, the #GreenNewDeal does not match up with these moral responsibilities.
text: In hampering American agriculture, the #GreenNewDeal does not match up with these moral responsibilities.

html: I realize there are those who think the GND is a moral imperative. But, farmers continuing to feed the world is also a moral imperative. Too many go hungry each day in America, ending this is also a moral imperative.
text:
I realize there are those who think the GND is a moral imperative. 
But, farmers continuing to feed the world is also a moral imperative. 
Too many go hungry each day in America, ending this is also a moral imperative.

html: These policy discussions must recognize the complexity of the agriculture and food value chain—growers, input suppliers, processors, handlers, and consumers. And, they must be based in reality to facilitate a genuine conversation between rural and urban constituencies.
text: These policy discussions must recognize the complexity of the agriculture and food value chain—growers, input suppliers, processors, handlers, and consumers.  And, they must be based in reality to facilitate a genuine conversation between rural and urban constituencies.

html: Consumers will assuredly continue to demand the choice of animal protein here in the U.S., and so any reasonable discussion on the agriculture sector’s contributions to solutions on climate change must begin with this acknowledgment.
text: Consumers will assuredly continue to demand the choice of animal protein here in the U.S., and so any reasonable discussion on the agriculture sector’s contributions to solutions on climate change must begin with this acknowledgment.

html: Regulating American farmers and ranchers out of business will only result in food and fiber production being outsourced to countries that do not have the same conservation-minded producers that we have here in the U.S.
text: Regulating American farmers and ranchers out of business will only result in food and fiber production being outsourced to countries that do not have the same conservation-minded producers that we have here in the U.S.

html: Over the last 50 years American farmers have reduced water use in pork production by 41%.
text: Over the last 50 years American farmers have reduced water use in pork production by 41%.

html: American farmers and ranchers raise the same amount of beef today as they did in the 1970s, but they do so with 33% fewer cattle.
text: American farmers and ranchers raise the same amount of beef today as they did in the 1970s, but they do so with 33% fewer cattle.

html: Obviously, we cannot, and do not, produce food in the same manner our grandparents did, because those methods were not sustainable and today would not produce food at the scope and scale our troubled and hungry world demands.
text: Obviously, we cannot, and do not, produce food in the same manner our grandparents did, because those methods were not sustainable and today would not produce food at the scope and scale our troubled and hungry world demands.

html: American farmers, ranchers, and others in rural America are constantly working to produce their crops and to raise their livestock in order to feed a growing world, and do so with constant challenges presented to them from Mother Nature.
text: American farmers, ranchers, and others in rural America are constantly working to produce their crops and to raise their livestock in order to feed a growing world, and do so with constant challenges presented to them from Mother Nature.

html: The @FoundationFAR leverages public and private dollars to bring together experts to identify and investigate the researchable questions whose answers have the potential to enhance the economic and environmental resilience of our food supply.
text: The @FoundationFAR leverages public and private dollars to bring together experts to identify and investigate the researchable questions whose answers have the potential to enhance the economic and environmental resilience of our food supply.

html: I do not question the intent of the authors of the #GreenNewDeal but they don’t know what they don’t know. They need to catch up with the Agriculture committee and with farm country.
text: I do not question the intent of the authors of the #GreenNewDeal but they don’t know what they don’t know. They need to catch up with the Agriculture committee and with farm country.

html: within agriculture, there is nothing “New” with the #GreenNewDeal
text: within agriculture, there is nothing “New” with the #GreenNewDeal

html: We must have comprehensive immigration reform, which starts with a secure border. We also need further resources at the southern border to deal with the humanitarian crisis hurting the thousands of migrants who attempt to enter our country.
text: We must have comprehensive immigration reform, which starts with a secure border. We also need further resources at the southern border to deal with the humanitarian crisis hurting the thousands of migrants who attempt to enter our country.

html: I agree with the president’s assessment that we have reached a crisis point at the border, and this is nothing new. For many years, control of our southern border has been a fundamental failure of our first obligation to protect the national security of the United States.
text: I agree with the president’s assessment that we have reached a crisis point at the border, and this is nothing new. For many years, control of our southern border has been a fundamental failure of our first obligation to protect the national security of the United States.

html: Roberts to @NSBAComm: There are nearly 300 school districts in Kansas. I've visited several schools and plan more visits soon. html: Roberts to @NSBAComm: As is routine in the Senate Ag Committee, we will work on child nutrition reauthorizations together, in a bipartisan fashion, to develop legislation to improve school meal programs. We are asking what is - and is not - working. #NSBAAI19
text: Roberts to @NSBAComm: As is routine in the Senate Ag Committee, we will work on child nutrition reauthorizations together, in a bipartisan fashion, to develop legislation to improve school meal programs. We are asking what is - and is not - working. #NSBAAI19

html: Roberts to @NSBAComm: @SecretarySonny provided needed flexibility to ensure you can make decisions to enable schools to serve nutritious meals that children will find appetizing. That is what these programs are about: feeding hungry children so they can learn & grow. #NSBAAI19
text: Roberts to @NSBAComm: @SecretarySonny provided needed flexibility to ensure you can make decisions to enable schools to serve nutritious meals that children will find appetizing. That is what these programs are about: feeding hungry children so they can learn & grow. #NSBAAI19

html: Roberts to @NSBAComm: School food service directors stretch dollars to provide nutritious, affordable meals to students & find creative ways to prepare foods students still eat. text: Roberts to @NSBAComm: School food service directors stretch dollars to provide nutritious, affordable meals to students & find creative ways to prepare foods students still eat. html: Navajo Code Talker Alfred K. Newman passed away at 94 years old this past Sunday. Newman served with 1st Battalion, 21st Marine Regiment, 3rd Marine Division during WWII, including Iwo Jima, Guam, and other island campaigns. Semper Fi, Marine.pic.twitter.com/6GbEXtLxK2
text:
Navajo Code Talker Alfred K. Newman passed away at 94 years old this past Sunday. Newman served with 1st Battalion, 21st Marine Regiment, 3rd Marine Division during WWII, including Iwo Jima, Guam, and other island campaigns.
 
Semper Fi, Marine.pic.twitter.com/6GbEXtLxK2

html: Roberts: All of these USDA positions require an unwavering dedication and commitment to serve constituents – our farmers, ranchers, consumers, businesses, and employees that are impacted on a daily basis by the decisions made at the Department of Agriculture.
text: Roberts: All of these USDA positions require an unwavering dedication and commitment to serve constituents – our farmers, ranchers, consumers, businesses, and employees that are impacted on a daily basis by the decisions made at the Department of Agriculture.

html: Roberts: There is no shortage of experience on this panel of USDA nominees, and I look forward to hearing more detail about how they would lead their respective agencies and handle these responsibilities.
text: Roberts: There is no shortage of experience on this panel of USDA nominees, and I look forward to hearing more detail about how they would lead their respective agencies and handle these responsibilities.

html: Roberts: The Under Secretary of Research, Education & Economics, to which Dr. Hutchins has been nominated, leads USDA's critical ag research mission. This position is USDA's Chief Scientist and is responsible for the coordination of research, education, & extension activities.
text: Roberts: The Under Secretary of Research, Education & Economics, to which Dr. Hutchins has been nominated, leads USDA's critical ag research mission. This position is USDA's Chief Scientist and is responsible for the coordination of research, education, & extension activities.

html: Roberts: The Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights, to which Mrs. Earp has been nominated, leads USDA’s civil rights programs, including program delivery, compliance, & equal employment opportunity.
text: Roberts: The Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights, to which Mrs. Earp has been nominated, leads USDA’s civil rights programs, including program delivery, compliance, & equal employment opportunity.

html: Roberts: The Under Secretary for Food Safety, to which Dr. Brashears has been nominated, oversees the Food Safety Inspection Service. This position ensures the safety and wholesomeness of meat, poultry, catfish & eggs.
text: Roberts: The Under Secretary for Food Safety, to which Dr. Brashears has been nominated, oversees the Food Safety Inspection Service. This position ensures the safety and wholesomeness of meat, poultry, catfish & eggs.

html: Roberts: @SecretarySonny, his team across USDA's 29 agencies & offices, & nearly 100k employees have been working on behalf of farmers, ranchers, consumers, & businesses that rely on their services. These missions will be even better served with necessary leadership in place.
text: Roberts: @SecretarySonny, his team across USDA's 29 agencies & offices, & nearly 100k employees have been working on behalf of farmers, ranchers, consumers, & businesses that rely on their services. These missions will be even better served with necessary leadership in place.

html: Roberts: The entire food and ag value chain relies on trade. This was particularly recognized in the last #FarmBill process when Congress, led by this Committee, created the position of the Under Secretary for Trade and Foreign Agricultural Affairs at USDA. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: The entire food and ag value chain relies on trade. This was particularly recognized in the last #FarmBill process when Congress, led by this Committee, created the position of the Under Secretary for Trade and Foreign Agricultural Affairs at USDA. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: Progress on NAFTA is extremely important, but equally so is the need for the U.S. to aggressively continue pursuing new Free Trade Agreements around the world. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: Progress on NAFTA is extremely important, but equally so is the need for the U.S. to aggressively continue pursuing new Free Trade Agreements around the world. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: I know that our team at @USTradeRep is working hard to bring our friends from Canada into the agreement as well, and I hope that we hear news on a strong NAFTA agreement very soon. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: I know that our team at @USTradeRep is working hard to bring our friends from Canada into the agreement as well, and I hope that we hear news on a strong NAFTA agreement very soon. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: I’ve been encouraged to hear that efforts to modernize NAFTA has been progressing. The announcement that the U.S. and Mexico have reached an agreement that will preserve the trading relationship the ag industry already enjoys was welcome news. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: I’ve been encouraged to hear that efforts to modernize NAFTA has been progressing. The announcement that the U.S. and Mexico have reached an agreement that will preserve the trading relationship the ag industry already enjoys was welcome news. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: Since 1994, when NAFTA went into force, the value of U.S. ag exports to Canada has increased by 271% and to Mexico by 305%. In 2017, the total value of U.S. ag exports was over $138 billion. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: Since 1994, when NAFTA went into force, the value of U.S. ag exports to Canada has increased by 271% and to Mexico by 305%. In 2017, the total value of U.S. ag exports was over $138 billion. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: In the early 90s, as Ranking Member of the House Ag Committee, I traveled with my good friend Chairman Kika de la Garza to build support for the brand new NAFTA. At that time, the total value of U.S. agriculture exports was $43 billion. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: In the early 90s, as Ranking Member of the House Ag Committee, I traveled with my good friend Chairman Kika de la Garza to build support for the brand new NAFTA. At that time, the total value of U.S. agriculture exports was $43 billion. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: Free Trade Agreements, including CAFTA, Korea, and many others have boosted the ag economy and supported broader U.S. economic growth. And of course, there is NAFTA. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: Free Trade Agreements, including CAFTA, Korea, and many others have boosted the ag economy and supported broader U.S. economic growth. And of course, there is NAFTA. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: For years, the United States has worked to establish itself as a reliable supplier around the world, through domestic agriculture policies like the #FarmBill, and through strong international trade policies. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: For years, the United States has worked to establish itself as a reliable supplier around the world, through domestic agriculture policies like the #FarmBill, and through strong international trade policies. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: I know @SecretarySonny and @USDA also recognize the need for long-term certainty and have made efforts to provide temporary relief to our hard-working producers. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: I know @SecretarySonny and @USDA also recognize the need for long-term certainty and have made efforts to provide temporary relief to our hard-working producers. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: On top of already low prices, agriculture has seen immediate negative impacts as a result of retaliatory trade actions. As time goes on without resolution, the concern of losing long-term market access only grows. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: On top of already low prices, agriculture has seen immediate negative impacts as a result of retaliatory trade actions. As time goes on without resolution, the concern of losing long-term market access only grows. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: We need to hold our trading partners accountable, but I am concerned that some of the trade actions we have seen in recent years are causing uncertainty and unpredictability for the agriculture industry. #agtrade #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: We need to hold our trading partners accountable, but I am concerned that some of the trade actions we have seen in recent years are causing uncertainty and unpredictability for the agriculture industry. #agtrade #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: The US has long had to work to overcome barriers to #agtrade around the world. Sometimes, barriers are regulations not based on sound science. Other times, foreign govts consistently choose not to adhere to/abide by the same rules to which we have all agreed. #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: The US has long had to work to overcome barriers to #agtrade around the world. Sometimes, barriers are regulations not based on sound science. Other times, foreign govts consistently choose not to adhere to/abide by the same rules to which we have all agreed. #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: Along with #FarmBill18, I hear about #agtrade. I hear from wheat growers about the need for market access. I hear from beef producers about barriers to trade. I hear from producers about trade policies impacting prices, decisions & livelihoods. These aren't new concerns.
text: Roberts: Along with #FarmBill18, I hear about #agtrade. I hear from wheat growers about the need for market access. I hear from beef producers about barriers to trade. I hear from producers about trade policies impacting prices, decisions & livelihoods. These aren't new concerns.

html: Roberts: As I’ve traveled through Kansas and around the country, having #FarmBill18 in place certainly tops the list of concerns I hear. The conference committee is doing our work to get a bill to the finish line as soon as possible. #agtrade
text: Roberts: As I’ve traveled through Kansas and around the country, having #FarmBill18 in place certainly tops the list of concerns I hear. The conference committee is doing our work to get a bill to the finish line as soon as possible. #agtrade

html: Roberts: The last couple of years have been very busy for the Members of the Senate Ag Committee, as we’ve worked hard to produce the #FarmBill18 that will provide certainty and predictability for U.S. farmers, ranchers, and growers. #agtrade
text: Roberts: The last couple of years have been very busy for the Members of the Senate Ag Committee, as we’ve worked hard to produce the #FarmBill18 that will provide certainty and predictability for U.S. farmers, ranchers, and growers. #agtrade

text: #farmbill conference: @SenPatRoberts says "Getting a farm bill done paramount to any other issue and concern...very close to finish line but lot of compromise that needs to be done."

html: Working on his 8th #FarmBill @SenPatRoberts chairing conference committee meeting - "Getting a farm bill done is PARAMOUNT to any other issue" #farmers #whathesaidpic.twitter.com/zWNzOL4f1l
text: Working on his 8th #FarmBill @SenPatRoberts chairing conference committee meeting - "Getting a farm bill done is PARAMOUNT to any other issue" #farmers #whathesaidpic.twitter.com/zWNzOL4f1l

html: Roberts: Most important, we must agree to a bill that provides our farmers, ranchers, and other rural stakeholders much needed certainty and predictability. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: Most important, we must agree to a bill that provides our farmers, ranchers, and other rural stakeholders much needed certainty and predictability. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: We must do our job. We MUST agree to a bill that provides producers certainty and predictability they deserve. We must commit to making the tough choices—and compromising to find common ground—to develop the best bill possible under these circumstances. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: We must do our job. We MUST agree to a bill that provides producers certainty and predictability they deserve. We must commit to making the tough choices—and compromising to find common ground—to develop the best bill possible under these circumstances. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: But, we must embrace the attitude of our producers --optimism and ingenuity. A farmer doesn’t plant the seed in the ground without the faith and optimism of harvesting a good crop. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: But, we must embrace the attitude of our producers --optimism and ingenuity. A farmer doesn’t plant the seed in the ground without the faith and optimism of harvesting a good crop. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: As I travel across Kansas, producers are facing the wrath of Mother Nature. Some farms are facing drought, others floods. Many producers are not looking forward to harvest, let alone the tough conversations with their lenders in the weeks ahead. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: As I travel across Kansas, producers are facing the wrath of Mother Nature. Some farms are facing drought, others floods. Many producers are not looking forward to harvest, let alone the tough conversations with their lenders in the weeks ahead. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: Agriculture, and specifically the #FarmBill, has consistently answered the call to do more with less. And, to those who say passing a Farm Bill in this environment is a daunting task, I say together we can get it done. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: Agriculture, and specifically the #FarmBill, has consistently answered the call to do more with less. And, to those who say passing a Farm Bill in this environment is a daunting task, I say together we can get it done. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: We must make tough choices and be judicious with the scarce resources we have. Each of our Committees have asked tough questions and reexamined programs to determine effectiveness over the last several years. We must ensure programs accomplish their purposes. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: We must make tough choices and be judicious with the scarce resources we have. Each of our Committees have asked tough questions and reexamined programs to determine effectiveness over the last several years. We must ensure programs accomplish their purposes. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: We need to grow more and raise more with fewer resources. That will take investments in research, new technology, lines of credit, and proper risk management. It takes the government providing tools, and then getting out of the producer’s way. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: We need to grow more and raise more with fewer resources. That will take investments in research, new technology, lines of credit, and proper risk management. It takes the government providing tools, and then getting out of the producer’s way. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: With trade & market uncertainty, we must provide certainty for trade & research prgms. Feeding an increasing population is not just an ag challenge, it's a national security challenge. Show me a country that cannot feed itself; I’ll show you a nation in chaos #farmbill18
text: Roberts: With trade & market uncertainty, we must provide certainty for trade & research prgms. Feeding an increasing population is not just an ag challenge, it's a national security challenge. Show me a country that cannot feed itself; I’ll show you a nation in chaos #farmbill18

html: Roberts: We can improve SNAP integrity w verification process changes, better quality control oversight & elimination of much of state performance bonuses. These could bring accountability & reduce error rates, which have resulted in billions in improper payments. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: We can improve SNAP integrity w verification process changes, better quality control oversight & elimination of much of state performance bonuses. These could bring accountability & reduce error rates, which have resulted in billions in improper payments. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: We can find ways to provide tools to states, to people, to employers and to non-profits that will get people working again. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: We can find ways to provide tools to states, to people, to employers and to non-profits that will get people working again. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: I share the goal of promoting work & self-sufficiency among SNAP participants. Investments in employment & training that demonstrate success, partnerships w/ the private sector, & more accountability can help get folks back on the path to longterm employment. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: I share the goal of promoting work & self-sufficiency among SNAP participants. Investments in employment & training that demonstrate success, partnerships w/ the private sector, & more accountability can help get folks back on the path to longterm employment. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: We must focus on program integrity and commonsense investments to strengthen our nutrition programs to ensure the pathway to long-term success of those in need of assistance. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: We must focus on program integrity and commonsense investments to strengthen our nutrition programs to ensure the pathway to long-term success of those in need of assistance. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: Let us not forget that in a few short decades, the global population will top 9 billion people. Ag will need to double in the near future to meet that demand. Accomplishing this task requires efficiency, not just on the farm & ranch, but also in government. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: Let us not forget that in a few short decades, the global population will top 9 billion people. Ag will need to double in the near future to meet that demand. Accomplishing this task requires efficiency, not just on the farm & ranch, but also in government. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: We must ensure that our voluntary conservation programs are keeping farm land in operation while protecting our agriculture lands, forests, and other natural resources. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: We must ensure that our voluntary conservation programs are keeping farm land in operation while protecting our agriculture lands, forests, and other natural resources. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: We are endeavoring to craft a #FarmBill18 that meets the needs of producers across all regions and all crops. All of agriculture is struggling, not just one or two commodities. We must have a bill that works across our great nation.
text: Roberts: We are endeavoring to craft a #FarmBill18 that meets the needs of producers across all regions and all crops. All of agriculture is struggling, not just one or two commodities. We must have a bill that works across our great nation.

html: Roberts: It is not an exaggeration to say our nation’s food and fiber production capability hangs in the balance with what we do here on the #farmbill. Time is of the essence. Let us work together to get this done. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: It is not an exaggeration to say our nation’s food and fiber production capability hangs in the balance with what we do here on the #farmbill. Time is of the essence. Let us work together to get this done. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: Both the House and Senate have taken the steps to get us to this point today. We are very close to the finish line, but we still have a lot of work—a lot of compromise—that remains to be done. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: Both the House and Senate have taken the steps to get us to this point today. We are very close to the finish line, but we still have a lot of work—a lot of compromise—that remains to be done. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: The goal, the responsibility, the absolute requirement is to provide farmers, ranchers, growers & everyone w/i America’s ag and food value chain certainty & predictability during these difficult times. This is paramount to many other issues and concerns. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: The goal, the responsibility, the absolute requirement is to provide farmers, ranchers, growers & everyone w/i America’s ag and food value chain certainty & predictability during these difficult times. This is paramount to many other issues and concerns. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: This is the 8th #farmbill that I’ve been a part of during my time in public service. The circumstances are always different, but we all have a history of working together in a bipartisan, bicameral fashion to find solutions and to get farm bills done. #farmbill18
text: Roberts: This is the 8th #farmbill that I’ve been a part of  during my time in public service. The circumstances are always different, but we all have a history of working together in a bipartisan, bicameral fashion to find solutions and to get farm bills done. #farmbill18

html: Roberts: Today, we continue that tradition as we work to agree on legislation that is critically important to our nation—the 2018 Farm Bill. #FarmBill18
text: Roberts: Today, we continue that tradition as we work to agree on legislation that is critically important to our nation—the 2018 Farm Bill. #FarmBill18

html: Roberts: I thank Chairman Conaway for passing the gavel to the Senate for the duration of the #FarmBill18 Conference. I recall a day in 1996, when as the House Ag Committee Chairman, I passed the gavel to the Chairman of the Senate Ag Committee at the time—Senator Richard Lugar.
text: Roberts: I thank Chairman Conaway for passing the gavel to the Senate for the duration of the #FarmBill18 Conference. I recall a day in 1996, when as the House Ag Committee Chairman, I passed the gavel to the Chairman of the Senate Ag Committee at the time—Senator Richard Lugar.

html: Great article on @WichitaState's Dr. Donald Blakeslee's work to locate a lost city in Kansas: "...Blakeslee located what he believes to be the lost city of Etzanoa, home to perhaps 20,000 people between 1450 and 1700."http://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-kansas-lost-city-20180819-htmlstory.html# …
text:
Great article on @WichitaState's Dr. Donald Blakeslee's work to locate a lost city in Kansas:

html: Active tornado warnings in Kansas. If your area is placed under a tornado warning take cover! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows.
text: Active tornado warnings in Kansas. If your area is placed under a tornado warning take cover! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows.

html: During tornado warnings, please avoid any unnecessary travel - keep roads clear for emergency responders and do not drive into the path of a tornado. Safest place is in a shelter, NOT in your vehicle.https://twitter.com/KansasEmergency/status/991788572985393153 …

html: Roberts: To many folks’ disbelief – Congress can walk and chew gum at the same time. In addition to writing #FarmBill18, we've held nearly 30 hearings & business meetings. #agandfood18
text: Roberts: To many folks’ disbelief – Congress can walk and chew gum at the same time. In addition to writing #FarmBill18, we've held nearly 30 hearings & business meetings. #agandfood18

html: Roberts: This isn’t the first time Senator Stabenow and I have worked on a #FarmBill. In 2012, we worked together to produce a bipartisan Farm Bill in the Senate, and we share the same goal in 2018 – a bipartisan #FarmBill18. #agandfood18
text: Roberts: This isn’t the first time Senator Stabenow and I have worked on a #FarmBill. In 2012, we worked together to produce a bipartisan Farm Bill in the Senate, and we share the same goal in 2018 – a bipartisan #FarmBill18. #agandfood18

html: Roberts: In a time when we hear a great deal about gridlock and partisanship, I am fortunate to lead a Committee that has proven to be the exception. #agandfood18
text: Roberts: In a time when we hear a great deal about gridlock and partisanship, I am fortunate to lead a Committee that has proven to be the exception. #agandfood18

html: Roberts: We've heard that #FarmBill18 needs to maintain and – where possible – strengthen USDA’s research, conservation, credit, trade, & commodity programs. We've consistently heard support for crop insurance, which is vital to helping farmers manage risk. #agandfood18
text: Roberts: We've heard that #FarmBill18 needs to maintain and – where possible – strengthen USDA’s research, conservation, credit, trade, & commodity programs. We've consistently heard support for crop insurance, which is vital to helping farmers manage risk. #agandfood18

html: Roberts: As Ag Committee Chairman, my primary task is to work for all ag producers. With that responsibility in mind, the Ag Committee has held 9 #FarmBill18 hearings during the 115th Congress, reviewing every title of the 2014 #FarmBill. #agandfood18pic.twitter.com/cKKIKfgq7j
text: Roberts: As Ag Committee Chairman, my primary task is to work for all ag producers. With that responsibility in mind, the Ag Committee has held 9 #FarmBill18 hearings during the 115th Congress, reviewing every title of the 2014 #FarmBill. #agandfood18pic.twitter.com/cKKIKfgq7j
